abstract.p: This document, part of the document number 7 in Carlo Conti Rossini's edition, part I of CCR 7 according to Alessandro Bausi's system of reference. While there are reasons to consider part I and part II of CCR 7 according to Bausi's system of reference as two parts one document, here they are treated as two documents on the basis of codicological disposition and mise en texte. In this document King Lālibalā's assigns certain lands as gʷǝlts to the monastery of Ham. The date noted in the manuscript is 409 year of Mercy, which corresponds to 1225 year of AD. The document is attested twice, once on the verso of the folium with a full-page miniature of a temple on the recto, while writing was evaluated as potentially contemporary to the actual date mentioned in the document. Further, without any significant difference, this document was presumably copied into a small quire, which contains a number of documents likely copied from older documents (originals?) in the sixteenth century.
